title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 § 640.2 - Mortgage recording taxes
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 § 640.2 - Mortgage recording taxes

State Regulations

Tax Law, §§ 253, 253-a, 253-d, 253-e
(a) There are six mortgage recording taxes
that may be imposed and they shall be known, for purposes of this Subchapter as
follows: (1)
the basic tax (imposed by section
253[1] of the Tax

Law); (2)
the additional tax
(imposed by section
253[2] of the Tax

Law); (3)
the special additional
tax (imposed by section
253[1-a] of the Tax

Law)
(4)
the City of New York tax
authorized to be imposed by section
253-a
of the Tax Law and imposed by
section 11-2601 of the New York City Administrative Code); (5)
the City of Yonkers tax (authorized to be
imposed by section
253-d
of the Tax Law and imposed by
section 92-123 of the Code of the City of Yonkers); and
(6)
the Broome County tax (authorized to be
imposed by section
253-e
of the Tax Law and imposed by Local

Law INTRO. No. 9, adopted July 21, 1994)
(b) The recording of every mortgage, unless
exempt from taxation, is subject to the basic tax and the special additional
tax. (See Part 644 of this Title for further information on tax exempt
mortgages.) In addition, the recording of a mortgage is subject to the
additional tax unless the imposition of such tax was suspended by local law, ordinance or resolution, the City of New York tax if the real property subject
to the mortgage is located, in whole or in part, in the City of New York, the

City of Yonkers tax if the real property subject to the mortgage is located, in
whole or in part, in the City of Yonkers and the Broome County tax if the real
property subject to the mortgage is located, in whole or in part, in Broome

County. Notes
